titleStmt.title: Aylmer Bourke Lambert, London, to James Edward Smith, Norwich, [Norfolk]

seriesStmt.ab: The Correspondence of Sir James Edward Smith, The Linnean Society's Archive Catalogue

sourceDesc.bibl: GB-110/JES/COR/6/64, The Linnean Society of London

abstract.p: Given [Lieutenant-]General Francis Grose's [(1758-1814) Governor of New South Wales, 1792-1794] collection of New South Wales plants collected by [William] Patterson [(1755-1810)]. Also collection of drawings of birds, fish, animals, and plants. Amused by Smith's letter in "Monthly Magazine" [in April 1808 edition, explaining the dissolution of his friendship with Richard Salisbury]. Dismisses Smith's suggestion that it is Dr [William Fordyce] Mavor [(1758-1837)] who writes in the magazine, everyone believes it is [Charles] Konig, gives his reasons.
